thread.title: Leaked photo reveals Huawei P10 in all its glory
thread.title_full: Leaked photo reveals Huawei P10 in all its glory

author: Stan Schroeder
title: Leaked photo reveals Huawei P10 in all its glory
text:
One of the most anticipated devices to come out of this year's Mobile World Congress in Barcelona is the Huawei P10. 
Now, what appears to be a full set of press-ready photos, courtesy of leaker Evan Blass, shows us how the device will look from all sides. 
SEE ALSO: Huawei to launch P10 flagship phone on February 26 
The phone seems to be quite similar to last year's P9 — dual, Leica-branded cameras on the back and all — with one big difference: The fingerprint sensor appears to have moved from the back of the device to a home button on the front. 
Huawei P10. pic.twitter.com/7UNx2w5blW 
— Evan Blass (@evleaks) February 22, 2017 
If this is true, it is an odd design choice at a time when basically all competitors are removing their front home buttons in order to make the screen larger. 
Apple's iPhone X/8, Samsung's Galaxy S8 and LG G6 are all rumored to employ a similar, home button-less design. 
To be fair, we're not even sure, at this point, if we're going to like the fact that these phones will basically be all-screen on the front. But, if these press renders are real, Huawei is definitely swimming against the current. 
The device is rumored to have a 5.2-inch screen and a Huawei Kirin 960 chipset, while the reports about RAM and storage are all over the place. One interesting rumor we're seeing is that the screen resolution will be increased from full HD (on the P9) to quad HD. The company could also launch two devices, with the larger, 5.5-inch one having a curved screen. 
Huawei will officially launch the P10 on Sunday, Feb. 26, in Barcelona, and Mashable will be there to cover the news. 
BONUS: This app helps the blind "see" by identifying objects around them
